meanings.definition: Growing or developing on the surface.
meanings.sent1: The epibolic plant had vibrant leaves that caught the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The painter used bright colors to create an epibolic mural on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The epibolic flowers seemed to dance in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an epibolic wave, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The epibolic design on the cake made it look like a work of art.

meanings.definition: Covering or extending over the surface.
meanings.sent1: The epibolic blanket kept her warm on cold nights.
meanings.sent2: The clouds formed an epibolic layer over the sky, blocking the sun.
meanings.sent3: His epibolic shadow stretched across the pavement.
meanings.sent4: The music created an epibolic atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The epibolic fog enveloped the entire town in a mysterious haze.

meanings.definition: Relating to the process of epiboly.
meanings.sent1: The epibolic changes in the embryo were carefully studied by the scientists.
meanings.sent2: The epibolic movement of cells was crucial for the development of the organism.
meanings.sent3: The epibolic dance routine impressed the judges with its precision.
meanings.sent4: His epibolic storytelling style captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The epibolic growth of the city mirrored its economic prosperity.
